_header: Example sending to you root of gentleness
_description: An epistle written by a lover to his mistress — four stanzas rhyme royal

BLCottVesDIX.First Lines: Exemplye sendynge to you rowte of gentylnesBothe true and trusty stok of all nature…
BLCottVesDIX.Last Lines: …to any so symple a wyked as Ithat lustyth not to offende hys souerayn lady
BLCottVesDIX.Note: Defective; followed by 3730, with no line break or other indication of beginning of 3730.
BLCottVesDIX.Editions:
Robbins,  Rossell Hope,
                        ed.  
             Secular Lyrics of the XIV and XV Centuries.
         2nd ed. Oxford: Clarendon, 1955: 200-1.
